cause.description:
There are only five species of rhinoceros left today. The Rhino species is over 50 millions years old. Rhinos used to be diverse and populous. There was even a rhino species native to North America. However, Rhinos are now close to extinction.
Rhino Population Estimates: White rhino: 17,480 Black rhino: 4,280 Greater One-horned rhino: 2,700-2,850 Sumatran Rhino: 200 Javan Rhino: 35-55
The more people know about Rhinos and their possible extinction, the more that can be done to increase rhino populations and save this species from extinction! So tell you friends!
1. Increase awareness
2. Raise money for the IRF
cause.mission: help to raise awareness for rhinos, their threats and how we can help to increase poplations.
cause.name: Save the Rhinos
